title: Transformative Learning Design in Higher Education via Dialectical Leadership: Social Relations and Institutional Improvement Strategies (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of leadership theories and organizational learning experience, understanding of higher education environments, and basic comprehension of social institutions and cultural diversity
context.additional_context: A practical learning program for corporate training officers and leadership development practitioners, emphasizing case-based learning and exploring strategies to link higher education institutions' social responsibility with civic education.

learning_goals: Learners can apply core concepts of dialectical leadership (acceptance of paradox, integrative thinking) to institutional and social relationship improvements in higher education.
Learners can propose innovative solutions in organizational conflict situations using a paradoxical mindset and civic engagement strategies.
Learners can present transformative learning environment design plans for educational institutions/companies aligned with social contexts (culture, rights, systems) through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
